title: Taste food and wine festival at historic farm in Macarthur Sept 27Travelandtourworld.com
text:
Taste food and wine festival at historic farm in Macarthur Sept 27
Fine food, wine and music can be enjoyed amongst the scenic surrounds of Camden Town Farm in Macarthur at the free ‘Taste Food Wine and Music Festival’ held on Sunday, September 27, 2015, from 12pm to 5pm.
Locals and visitors to the Macarthur region will bring picnic rugs, grab a spot on the lawn and enjoy fresh produce, jams, chutneys and preserves, as well as sampling wine and beer from a number of local suppliers. Cooking demonstrations, live entertainment, children’s cooking workshops, jumping castle and face painting are just some of the activities that will be on offer, making the event one for the whole family to enjoy.
The fun-loving and entertaining Gourmet Pommies, Will and Steve, will wow audiences with a one-hour cooking demonstration and a meet and greet when they visit Camden to share their love and passion for food!
The ‘Taste Food, Wine and Music Festival will mark the conclusion of the Camden Festival, a two-week long celebration of the historic town’s culture and heritage. Other festival events included a Kids’ Fun Day, a Cinema Under the Stars and the annual public opening of Camden Park House, the 1834 home of colonial pioneers John and Elizabeth Macarthur.
The Food, Wine and Music Festival will be held at Camden Town Farm in Camden, a working community farm run by volunteers. Originally a 52-hectare dairy farm, it was bequeathed to the local community and its original slab hut and surrounding building remain to this day, making it a rustic and picturesque location to finish the Camden Festival.
